Title: What are some examples of great marketing?
Body:
I don't know if anyone else has answered about how Amul marketed it's Butter Cookies on social media.

Amul is known for its good marketing ideas, from the advertisements using their mascot- Amul girl, to creating the famous ice-cream vs frozen dessert stir among its competitors.

The advertisement of its butter cookies on social media is nothing less than a genius.

So, Amul, a market leader in dairy and dairy products in India decided to launch it's Butter cookies in India

Now, Amul may face a lot of competition, as India already has mammoth number of competitors in the biscuits and cookies section, so what does it decide to do?

Title: What is the best way to start making money online with affiliate marketing?
Body:
No, not even close to the best way.
Say you’re promoting a store that sells novelty electronics. Every customer you send makes you say 15% of the sale. Who gets the other 85%? These novelty electronics items are most likely manufactured in China and purchased in bulk $2 to be sold for $20. People who want to get rich try affiliate marketing and now and then some get lucky and manage to make enough money and learn enough about the system to actually move on to getting rich. People who already understand how business online works get people who want to get rich to make them rich. You start a store, join an affiliate network as a merchant, and you get rich off of affiliate marketers trying to get rich. Its never the person promoting other people’s work, products or ideas who get rich it is those who manipulate others into doing their work for them.

Now say you want to get rich, forget everything you’ve learned about affiliate marketing. Study the markets themselves. Look at what the other side, the merchants/advertisers are doing. See if you can find where they are getting their products (a simple google search for bulk amounts of a specific product they sell on their site can find a supplier), look how they market their business, look for what they use to encourage others to promote their business for it.

I used to own almost a dozen of those “paid survey” aka GPT sites and even started an advertising network running offers on dozens more of those sites. I was on track to earning 6 figures a year from them, but I got hit hard with a lot of fraud (and a good portion of that fraud although seemingly from Vietnam I have reason to believe it was committed by the very company that was the number one source of fraud prevention in the industry at the time) and I lost pretty much all of it. What I didn’t lose I sold off to cover the losses and the money I had left over I had 2 options: Start over or move on. I didn’t have the stomach for it, I didn’t like the idea of carrying on getting people to make me money by telling them they’d somehow get rich from it. Now I do web design and marketing as a side business, property management, and spend my extra time on some various projects I’m working on. The point is, the question you should be asking is how can you get the affiliate marketers to work for you.

An affiliate marketer that invests a couple thousand dollars can make a decent living. Someone who invests $5k into starting something up and then hiring affiliate marketers can make a fortune. I had to go to every site I could find, research everything thing I could get my hands on, investigate every part of the business and the other business owners weren’t exactly eager to share their secrets. So, the answer is no and the answer you didn’t ask for is this: No one who can teach you how to make a lot of money online will, and anyone who says they can teach you just wants you to make a lot of money for them.

Title: How can I generate website traffic with $0 marketing budget?
Body:
Well, if that's the case - no cash for acquiring customers 2 days ahead of the launch - then I hope you will learn a very hard lesson for your next startup :(

If it makes you feel any better - you're not alone. We all made this mistake at some point.

There are only two vehicles you can instrument to reach your audience. Money and time.

Money gets you instant traffic/leads, and from that point on, the game simply boils down to finding a positive ROI channel before you burn all your (or your investor's) cash. On the flip side - I wound't recommend spending money at this point anyhow, as you most probably don't know your quintessential customer yet, nor you have clear understanding on their perceived value for your product/service. As a result, you're unable to craft the right marketing lingo that would be used to carry out your campaigns. Essentially, you would be just pouring money down the drain.

Now, back to the topic - if you don't have the money, you simply have to invest the most valuable resource you have in your life. Your time.

The trick with this (and the lesson you probably learned by now) is you cannot invest the time two days ahead of your launch, with no money left in the bank. You have to start investing T - 1 year. Why? Because it takes time to build your reach and credibility.

Building reach and credibility is the most successful way to establish relationship with your customer base, yet it is the most difficult one at the same time. Clearly, that is why everyone would love to take the shortcut, i.e. spend marketing dollars to the same effect.

Here's an example I'm genuinely amazed with, a "hack" Buffer (company) did to build their reach and credibility.

By riding the hype of developing a culture of transparency, and blogging on building full transparency into their company culture, they build their reach and credibility - with zero dollars invested :)

1. Build brand awareness 

  • People perceive Buffer as a place that is transparent, thus honest and trustworthy. That automatically helps prospects / leads connect on a positive emotional level with their product, which in turn increases long-term conversions.

2. Generate buzz and acquire inbound traffic

  • Although I cannot know for sure, I bet a whole dollar that transparency/culture section on Buffer's blog is the #1 source of traffic they have (or at least it was when they were building their reach). Being very thought-provoking topic, it naturally yields a lot of social media shares, inspires discussion and analysis.

Result: Build reach and credibility

Voilà. It just takes great strategy, tons of energy and a few years... but... there you go :)

There is already quite a few great answers on what platforms/services you can leverage to start building your reach, so I won't go into that.
